refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para:
The Kerberos locator plugin sssd_krb5_locator_plugin is used by the Kerberos provider of
sssd 8
to tell the Kerberos libraries what Realm and which KDC to use. Typically this is done in
krb5.conf 5
which is always read by the Kerberos libraries. To simplify the configuration the Realm and the KDC can be defined in
sssd.conf 5
as described in
sssd-krb5.conf 5

sssd 8
puts the Realm and the name or IP address of the KDC into the environment variables SSSD_KRB5_REALM and SSSD_KRB5_KDC respectively. When sssd_krb5_locator_plugin is called by the kerberos libraries it reads and evaluates these variables and returns them to the libraries.

refsect1.title: NOTES
refsect1.para: Not all Kerberos implementations support the use of plugins. If sssd_krb5_locator_plugin is not available on your system you have to edit /etc/krb5.conf to reflect your Kerberos setup.
If the environment variable SSSD_KRB5_LOCATOR_DEBUG is set to any value debug messages will be sent to stderr.
